others simply en- joyed hearing how the master talked, while the cleverest among them, including the chief steward, understood from this speech how they could best handle the master for their own ends. 
The chief steward expressed great sympathy with Pierre's intentions, but remarked that be- sides these changes it would be necessary to go into the general state of affairs which was far from satisfactory.
